Name: PREAMBLE
Name and territory of the Union.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States.
The States and the territories thereof shall be as specified in the First Schedule.
The territory of India shall comprise

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the territories of the States;
the Union territories specified in the First Schedule; and
such other territories as may be acquired.

Name: Admission or establishment of new States.
ArtDesc: Parliament may by law admit into the Union, or establish, new States on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit.

Name: Sikkim to be associated with the Union
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution

Name: Formation of new States and alteration of areas, boundaries or names of existing States.

Explanations.Explanation: In this article, in clauses (a) to (e), "State" includes a Union territory, but in the proviso, "State" does not include a Union territory.
The power conferred on Parliament by clause (a) includes the power to form a new State or Union territory by uniting a part of any State or Union territory to any other State or Union territory.

Name: Laws made under articles 2 and 3 to provide for the amendment of the First and the Fourth Schedules and supplemental, incidental and consequential matters.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Any law referred to in article 2 or article 3 shall contain such provisions for the amendment of the First Schedule and the Fourth Schedule as may be necessary to give effect to the provisions of the law and may also contain such supplemental, incidental and consequential provisions (including provisions as to representation in Parliament and in the Legislature or Legislatures of the State or States affected by such law) as Parliament may deem necessary.
No such law as aforesaid shall be deemed to be an amendment of this Constitution for the purposes of article 368.

Name: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution.
ArtDesc:
At the commencement of this Constitution, every person who has his domicile in the territory of India and—
(a) who was born in the territory of India; or
(b) either of whose parents was born in the territory of India; or
(c) who has been ordinarily resident in the territory of India for not less than five years immediately preceding such commencement,
shall be a citizen of India.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons who have migrated to India from Pakistan.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in article 5, a person who has migrated to the territory of India from the territory now included in Pakistan shall be deemed to be a citizen of India at the commencement of this Constitution if—
(a) he or either of his parents or any of his grand-parents was born in India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935 (as originally enacted); and
(b) (i) in the case where such person has so migrated before the nineteenth day of July, 1948, he has been ordinarily resident in the territory of India since the date of his migration, or
(ii) in the case where such person has so migrated on or after the nineteenth day of July, 1948, he has been registered as a citizen of India by an officer appointed in that behalf by the Government of the Dominion of India on an application made by him therefor to such officer before the commencement of this Constitution in the form and manner prescribed by that Government:
Provided that no person shall be so registered unless he has been resident in the territory of India for at least six months immediately preceding the date of his application.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in articles 5 and 6, a person who has after the first day of March, 1947, migrated from the territory of India to the territory now included in Pakistan shall not be deemed to be a citizen of India:
Provided that nothing in this article shall apply to a person who, after having so migrated to the territory now included in Pakistan, has returned to the territory of India under a permit for resettlement or permanent return issued by or under the authority of any law and every such person shall for the purposes of clause (b) of article 6 be deemed to have migrated to the territory of India after the nineteenth day of July, 1948.

Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons of Indian origin residing outside India.
ArtDesc: Notwithstanding anything in article 5, any person who or either of whose parents or any of whose grandparents was born in India as defined in the Government of India Act, 1935 (as originally enacted), and who is ordinarily residing in any country outside India as so defined shall be deemed to be a citizen of India if he has been registered as a citizen of India by the diplomatic or consular representative of India in the country where he is for the time being residing on an application made by him therefor to such diplomatic or consular representative, whether before or after the commencement of this Constitution, in the form and manner prescribed by the Government of the Dominion of India or the Government of India.

Name: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State not to be citizens.
ArtDesc: No person shall be a citizen of India by virtue of article 5, or be deemed to be a citizen of India by virtue of article 6 or article 8, if he has voluntarily acquired the citizenship of any foreign State.

Name: Continuance of the rights of citizenship.
ArtDesc: Every person who is or is deemed to be a citizen of India under any of the foregoing provisions of this Part shall, subject to the provisions of any law that may be made by Parliament, continue to be such citizen.

Name: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law.
ArtDesc: Nothing in the foregoing provisions of this Part shall derogate from the power of Parliament to make any provision with respect to the acquisition and termination of citizenship and all other matters relating to citizenship.

Name: Definition.
ArtDesc: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, "the State" includes the Government and Parliament of India and the Government and the Legislature of each of the States and all local or other authorities within the territory of India or under the control of the Government of India.

Name: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of the fundamental rights.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All laws in force in the territory of India immediately before the commencement of this Constitution, in so far as they are inconsistent with the provisions of this Part, shall, to the extent of such inconsistency, be void.
The State shall not make any law which takes away or abridges the rights conferred by this Part and any law made in contravention of this clause shall, to the extent of the contravention, be void.
In this article, unless the context otherwise requires,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: "law" includes any Ordinance, order, bye-law, rule, regulation, notification, custom or usage having in the territory of India the force of law;

"laws in force" includes laws passed or made by a Legislature or other competent authority in the territory of India before the commencement of this Constitution and not previously repealed, notwithstanding that any such law or any part thereof may not be then in operation either at all or in particular areas.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in this article shall apply to any amendment of this Constitution made under article 368.

Name: Equality before law.
ArtDesc: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.

Name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: The State shall not discriminate against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them.
No citizen shall, on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them, be subject to any disability, liability, restriction or condition with regard to—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: access to shops, public restaurants, hotels and places of public entertainment; or
the use of wells, tanks, bathing ghats, roads and places of public resort maintained wholly or partly out of State funds or dedicated to the use of the general public.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any special provision for women and children.

Nothing in this article or in clause (2) of article 29 shall prevent the State from making any special provision for the advancement of any socially and educationally backward classes of citizens or for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes

Nothing in this article or in sub-clause (g) of clause (1) of article 19 shall prevent the State from making any special provision, by law, for the advancement of any socially and educationally backward classes of citizens or for the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes in so far as such special provisions relate to their admission to educational institutions including private educational institutions, whether aided or unaided by the State, other than the minority educational institutions referred to in clause (1) of article 30.
Nothing in this article or sub-clause (g) of clause (1) of article 19 or clause (2) of article 29 shall prevent the State from making,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: any special provision for the advancement of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clauses (4) and (5); and

any special provision for the advancement of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clauses (4) and (5) in so far as such special provisions relate to their admission to educational institutions including private educational institutions, whether aided or unaided by the State, other than the minority educational institutions referred to in clause (1) of article 30, which in the case of reservation would be in addition to the existing reservations and subject to a maximum of ten per cent. of the total seats in each category.

Explanations.Explanation: For the purposes of this article and article 16, "economically weaker sections" shall be such as may be notified by the State from time to time on the basis of family income and other indicators of economic disadvantage.

Name: Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: There shall be equality of opportunity for all citizens in matters relating to employment or appointment to any office under the State.

No citizen shall, on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, descent, place of birth, residence or any of them, be ineligible for, or discriminated against in respect of, any employment or office under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent Parliament from making any law prescribing, in regard to a class or classes of employment or appointment to an office under the Government of, or any local or other authority within, a State or Union territory, any requirement as to residence within that State or Union territory prior to such employment or appointment.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for the reservation of appointments or posts in favour of any backward class of citizens which, in the opinion of the State, is not adequately represented in the services under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for reservation in matters of promotion, with consequential seniority, to any class or classes of posts in the services under the State in favour of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes which, in the opinion of the State, are not adequately represented in the services under the State.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from considering any unfilled vacancies of a year which are reserved for being filled up in that year in accordance with any provision for reservation made under clause (4) or clause (4A) as a separate class of vacancies to be filled up in any succeeding year or years and such class of vacancies shall not be considered together with the vacancies of the year in which they are being filled up for determining the ceiling of fifty per cent. reservation on total number of vacancies of that year.

Nothing in this article shall affect the operation of any law which provides that the incumbent of an office in connection with the affairs of any religious or denominational institution or any member of the governing body thereof shall be a person professing a particular religion or belonging to a particular denomination.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from making any provision for the reservation of appointments or posts in favour of any economically weaker sections of citizens other than the classes mentioned in clause (4), in addition to the existing reservation and subject to a maximum of ten per cent. of the posts in each category.

Name: Abolition of Untouchability.
ArtDesc: "Untouchability" is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden. The enforcement of any disability arising out of “Untouchability” shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No title, not being a military or academic distinction, shall be conferred by the State.
No citizen of India shall accept any title from any foreign State.
No person who is not a citizen of India shall, while he holds any office of profit or trust under the State, accept without the consent of the President any title from any foreign State.
No person holding any office of profit or trust under the State shall, without the consent of the President, accept any present, emolument, or office of any kind from or under any foreign State.

Name: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All citizens shall have the right—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: to freedom of speech and expression;
to assemble peaceably and without arms;
to form associations or unions or co-operative societies;
to move freely throughout the territory of India;
to reside and settle in any part of the territory of India; and
to acquire, hold and dispose of property;
to practise any profession, or to carry on any occupation, trade or business

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Nothing in sub-clause (a) of clause (1) shall affect the operation of any existing law, or prevent the State from making any law, in so far as such law imposes reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India,] the security of the State, friendly relations with foreign States, public order, decency or morality, or in relation to contempt of court, defamation or incitement to an offence.

Nothing in sub-clause (b) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India or public order, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause.

Nothing in sub-clause (c) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India or public order or morality, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause.

Nothing in sub-clauses (d) and (e) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of any of the rights conferred by the said sub-clauses either in the interests of the general public or for the protection of the interests of any Scheduled Tribe.

Nothing in sub-clause (g) of the said clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it imposes, or prevent the State from making any law imposing, in the interests of the general public, reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause, and, in particular, nothing in the said sub-clause shall affect the operation of any existing law in so far as it relates to, or prevent the State from making any law relating to,—
(i) the professional or technical qualifications necessary for practising any profession or carrying on any occupation, trade or business, or
(ii) the carrying on by the State, or by a corporation owned or controlled by the State, of any trade, business, industry or service, whether to the exclusion, complete or partial, of citizens or otherwise.

Name: Protection in respect of conviction for offences.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No person shall be convicted of any offence except for violation of a law in force at the time of the commission of the Act charged as an offence, nor be subjected to a penalty greater than that which might have been inflicted under the law in force at the time of the commission of the offence.
No person shall be prosecuted and punished for the same offence more than once.
No person accused of any offence shall be compelled to be a witness against himself.

Name: Protection of life and personal liberty.
ArtDesc: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

Name: Right to education.
ArtDesc: The State shall provide free and compulsory education to all children of the age of six to fourteen years in such manner as the State may, by law, determine.

Name: Protection against arrest and detention in certain cases.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No person who is arrested shall be detained in custody without being informed, as soon as may be, of the grounds for such arrest nor shall he be denied the right to consult, and to be defended by, a legal practitioner of his choice.

Every person who is arrested and detained in custody shall be produced before the nearest magistrate within a period of twenty-four hours of such arrest excluding the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to the court of the magistrate and no such person shall be detained in custody beyond the said period without the authority of a magistrate.
Nothing in clauses (1) and (2) shall apply—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: to any person who for the time being is an enemy alien; or
to any person who is arrested or detained under any law providing for preventive detention.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No law providing for preventive detention shall authorise the detention of a person for a longer period than three months unless—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc:
an Advisory Board consisting of persons who are, or have been, or are qualified to be appointed as, Judges of a High Court has reported before the expiration of the said period of three months that there is in its opinion sufficient cause for such detention:
Provided that nothing in this sub-clause shall authorise the detention of any person beyond the maximum period prescribed by any law made by Parliament under sub-clause (b) of clause (7); or
such person is detained in accordance with the provisions of any law made by Parliament under sub-clauses (a) and (b) of clause (7).

Clauses.ClauseDesc: When any person is detained in pursuance of an order made under any law providing for preventive detention, the authority making the order shall, as soon as may be, communicate to such person the grounds on which the order has been made and shall afford him the earliest opportunity of making a representation against the order.

Nothing in clause (5) shall require the authority making any such order as is referred to in that clause to disclose facts which such authority considers to be against the public interest to disclose.
Parliament may by law prescribe—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the circumstances under which, and the class or classes of cases in which, a person may be detained for a period longer than three months under any law providing for preventive detention without obtaining the opinion of an Advisory Board in accordance with the provisions of sub-clause (a) of clause (4);
the maximum period for which any person may in any class or classes of cases be detained under any law providing for preventive detention; and
the procedure to be followed by an Advisory Board in an inquiry under sub-clause (a) of clause (4).

Name: Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Traffic in human beings and begar and other similar forms of forced labour are prohibited and any contravention of this provision shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

Nothing in this article shall prevent the State from imposing compulsory service for public purposes, and in imposing such service the State shall not make any discrimination on grounds only of religion, race, caste or class or any of them.

Name: Prohibition of employment of children in factories, etc.
ArtDesc: No child below the age of fourteen years shall be employed to work in any factory or mine or engaged in any other hazardous employment.

Name: Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice and propagation of religion.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Subject to public order, morality and health and to the other provisions of this Part, all persons are equally entitled to freedom of conscience and the right freely to profess, practise and propagate religion.
Nothing in this article shall affect the operation of any existing law or prevent the State from making any law—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: regulating or restricting any economic, financial, political or other secular activity which may be associated with religious practice;
providing for social welfare and reform or the throwing open of Hindu religious institutions of a public character to all classes and sections of Hindus.

Explanations.Explanation: The wearing and carrying of kirpans shall be deemed to be included in the profession of the Sikh religion.

In sub-clause (b) of clause (2), the reference to Hindus shall be construed as including a reference to persons professing the Sikh, Jaina or Buddhist religion, and the reference to Hindu religious institutions shall be construed accordingly.

Name: Freedom to manage religious affairs.
Freedom as to payment of taxes for promotion of any particular religion.
ArtDesc: No person shall be compelled to pay any taxes, the proceeds of which are specifically appropriated in payment of expenses for the promotion or maintenance of any particular religion or religious denomination.

Name: Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction or religious worship in certain educational institutions

Clauses.ClauseDesc: No religious instruction shall be provided in any educational institution wholly maintained out of State funds.

Nothing in clause (1) shall apply to an educational institution which is administered by the State but has been established under any endowment or trust which requires that religious instruction shall be imparted in such institution.

No person attending any educational institution recognised by the State or receiving aid out of State funds shall be required to take part in any religious instruction that may be imparted in such institution or to attend any religious worship that may be conducted in such institution or in any premises attached thereto unless such person or, if such person is a minor, his guardian has given his consent thereto.
Any section of the citizens residing in the territory of India or any part thereof having a distinct language, script or culture of its own shall have the right to conserve the same.
No citizen shall be denied admission into any educational institution maintained by the State or receiving aid out of State funds on grounds only of religion, race, caste, language or any of them.

Name: Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: All minorities, whether based on religion or language, shall have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice.

In making any law providing for the compulsory acquisition of any property of an educational institution established and administered by a minority, referred to in clause (1), the State shall ensure that the amount fixed by or determined under such law for the acquisition of such property is such as would not restrict or abrogate the right guaranteed under that clause.

The State shall not, in granting aid to educational institutions, discriminate against any educational institution on the ground that it is under the management of a minority, whether based on religion or language.

Name: Compulsory acquisition of property.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution

Name: Saving of laws providing for acquisition of estates, etc.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: Notwithstanding anything contained in article 13, no law providing for—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the acquisition by the State of any estate or of any rights therein or the extinguishment or modification of any such rights, or
the taking over of the management of any property by the State for a limited period either in the public interest or in order to secure the proper management of the property, or
the amalgamation of two or more corporations either in the public interest or in order to secure the proper management of any of the corporations, or

the extinguishment or modification of any rights of managing agents, secretaries and treasurers, managing directors, directors or managers of corporations, or of any voting rights of shareholders thereof, or

the extinguishment or modification of any rights accruing by virtue of any agreement, lease or licence for the purpose of searching for, or winning, any mineral or mineral oil, or the premature termination or cancellation of any such agreement, lease or licence,

Clauses.FollowUp:
shall be deemed to be void on the ground that it is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by article 14 or article 19:
Provided that where such law is a law made by the Legislature of a State, the provisions of this article shall not apply thereto unless such law, having been reserved for the consideration of the President, has received his assent:
Provided further that where any law makes any provision for the acquisition by the State of any estate and where any land comprised therein is held by a person under his personal cultivation, it shall not be lawful for the State to acquire any portion of such land as is within the ceiling limit applicable to him under any law for the time being in force or any building or structure standing thereon or appurtenant thereto, unless the law relating to the acquisition of such land, building or structure, provides for payment of compensation at a rate which shall not be less than the market value thereof.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: In this article,—

SubClauses.SubClauseDesc: the expression “rights”, in relation to an estate, shall include any rights vesting in a proprietor, sub-proprietor, under-proprietor, tenure-holder, raiyat, under-raiyator other intermediary and any rights or privileges in respect of land revenue.

Name: Validation of certain Acts and Regulations.
ArtDesc: Without prejudice to the generality of the provisions contained in article 31A, none of the Acts and Regulations specified in the Ninth Schedule nor any of the provisions thereof shall be deemed to be void, or ever to have become void, on the ground that such Act, Regulation or provision is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by, any provisions of this Part, and notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any court or Tribunal to the contrary, each of the said Acts and Regulations shall, subject to the power of any competent Legislature to repeal or amend it, continue in force.

Name: Saving of laws giving effect to certain directive principles.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything contained in article 13, no law giving effect to the policy of the State towards securing all or any of the principles laid down in Part IV shall be deemed to be void on the ground that it is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by article 14 or article 19; and no law containing a declaration that it is for giving effect to such policy shall be called in question in any court on the ground that it does not give effect to such policy:
Provided that where such law is made by the Legislature of a State, the provisions of this article shall not apply thereto unless such law, having been reserved for the consideration of the President, has received his assent.

Name: Saving of laws in respect of anti-national activities.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution.

Name: Remedies for enforcement of rights conferred by this Part.

Clauses.ClauseDesc: The right to move the Supreme Court by appropriate proceedings for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this Part is guaranteed.

The Supreme Court shall have power to issue directions or orders or writs, including writs in the nature of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, quo warranto and certiorari, whichever may be appropriate, for the enforcement of any of the rights conferred by this Part.

Without prejudice to the powers conferred on the Supreme Court by clauses (1) and (2), Parliament may by law empower any other court to exercise within the local limits of its jurisdiction all or any of the powers exercisable by the Supreme Court under clause (2)
The right guaranteed by this article shall not be suspended except as otherwise provided for by this Constitution.

Name: Constitutional validity of State laws not to be considered in proceedings under article 32.
ArtDesc: Omitted by the Constitution.

Name: Power of Parliament to modify the rights conferred by this Part in their application to Forces, etc.
ArtDesc:
Parliament may, by law, determine to what extent any of the rights conferred by this Part shall, in their application to,—
(a) the members of the Armed Forces; or
(b) the members of the Forces charged with the maintenance of public order; or
(c) persons employed in any bureau or other organisation established by the State for purposes of intelligence or counter intelligence; or
(d) person employed in, or in connection with, the telecommunication systems set up for the purposes of any Force, bureau or organisation referred to in clauses (a) to (c), be restricted or abrogated so as to ensure the proper discharge of their duties and the maintenance of discipline among them.

Name: Restriction on rights conferred by this Part while martial law is in force in any area.
ArtDesc: Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing provisions of this Part, Parliament may by law indemnify any person in the service of the Union or of a State or any other person in respect of any act done by him in connection with the maintenance or restoration of order in any area within the territory of India where martial law was in force or validate any sentence passed, punishment inflicted, forfeiture ordered or other act done under martial law in such area.

Name: Legislation to give effect to the provisions of this Part.
ArtDesc:
Notwithstanding anything in this Constitution,—
(a) Parliament shall have, and the Legislature of a State shall not have, power to make laws—
(i) with respect to any of the matters which under clause (3) of article 16, clause (3) of article 32, article 33 and article 34 may be provided for by law made by Parliament; and
(ii) for prescribing punishment for those acts which are declared to be offences under this Part,
and Parliament shall, as soon as may be after the commencement of this Constitution, make laws for prescribing punishment for the acts referred to in sub-clause (ii);
(b) any law in force immediately before the commencement of this Constitution in the territory of India with respect to any of the matters referred to in sub-clause (i) of clause (a) or providing for punishment for any act referred to in sub-clause (ii) of that clause shall, subject to the terms thereof and to any adaptations and modifications that may be made therein under article 372, continue in force until altered or repealed or amended by Parliament.

Explanations.Explanation: In this article, the expression “law in force” has the same meaning as in article 372.

Name: Definition
ArtDesc: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, the State has the same meaning as in Part III.

Name: Application of the principles contained in this Part
ArtDesc: The provisions contained in this Part shall not be enforceable by any court, but the principles therein laid down are nevertheless fundamental in the governance of the country.

Name: State to secure a social order for the promotion of welfare of the people
ArtDesc: The State shall strive to promote the welfare of the people by securing a social order permeated by justice—social, economic and political...

Name: Certain principles of policy to be followed by the State
ArtDesc:
The State shall, in particular, direct its policy towards securing—
(a) that the citizens, men and women equally, have the right to an adequate means of livelihood...
(f) that children are not abused and that childhood and youth are protected against exploitation.

Name: Equal justice and free legal aid
ArtDesc: The State shall secure that the operation of the legal system promotes justice, on a basis of equal opportunity, and shall provide free legal aid...

Name: Organisation of village panchayats
ArtDesc: The State shall take steps to organise village panchayats and endow them with such powers and authority...

Name: Right to work, education and public assistance
ArtDesc: The State shall, within the limits of its economic capacity and development, make effective provision for securing the right to work, to education and to public assistance in cases of unemployment...

Name: Provision for just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief
ArtDesc: The State shall make provision for securing just and humane conditions of work and for maternity relief.

Name: Living wage, etc., for workers
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to secure, by suitable legislation or economic organisation or in any other way, to all workers, a living wage, conditions of work ensuring a decent standard of life...

Name: Participation of workers in management of industries
ArtDesc: The State shall take steps, by suitable legislation or in any other way, to secure the participation of workers in the management of undertakings...

Name: Uniform civil code for the citizens
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to secure for the citizens a uniform civil code throughout the territory of India.

Name: Provision for early childhood care and education to children below the age of six years
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to provide early childhood care and education for all children until they complete the age of six years.

Name: Promotion of educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and other weaker sections
ArtDesc: The State shall promote with special care the educational and economic interests of the weaker sections of the people, and shall protect them from social injustice and all forms of exploitation.

Name: Duty of the State to raise the level of nutrition and the standard of living and to improve public health
ArtDesc: The State shall regard the raising of the level of nutrition and the standard of living of its people and the improvement of public health as among its primary duties...

Name: Organisation of agriculture and animal husbandry
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to organise agriculture and animal husbandry on modern and scientific lines and shall take steps to preserve and improve the breeds...

Name: Protection and improvement of environment and safeguarding of forests and wildlife
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to protect and improve the environment and to safeguard the forests and wildlife of the country.

Name: Protection of monuments and places and objects of national importance
ArtDesc: It shall be the obligation of the State to protect every monument or place or object of artistic or historic interest...

Name: Separation of judiciary from the executive
ArtDesc: The State shall take steps to separate the judiciary from the executive in the public services of the State.

Name: Promotion of international peace and security
ArtDesc: The State shall endeavour to promote international peace and security; maintain just and honourable relations between nations...

Name: Fundamental duties
ArtDesc: It shall be the duty of every citizen of India— (a) to abide by the Constitution and respect its ideals and institutions...

Name: The President of India
ArtDesc: There shall be a President of India.

Name: Executive power of the Union
ArtDesc: The executive power of the Union shall be vested in the President and shall be exercised by him either directly or through officers...

Name: Election of President
ArtDesc: The President shall be elected by the members of an electoral college consisting of the elected members of both Houses of Parliament...

Name: Manner of election of President
ArtDesc: The election of the President shall be held in accordance with the system of proportional representation by means of the single transferable vote...

Name: Term of office of President
ArtDesc: The President shall hold office for a term of five years from the date on which he enters upon his office...

Name: Eligibility for re-election
ArtDesc: A person who holds, or who has held, office as President shall, subject to the other provisions of this Constitution, be eligible for re-election to that office.

Name: Qualifications for election as President
ArtDesc: No person shall be eligible for election as President unless he— (a) is a citizen of India; (b) has completed the age of thirty-five years...

Name: Conditions of President’s office
ArtDesc: The President shall not hold any other office of profit and shall be entitled to use of official residence and allowances...

Name: Oath or affirmation by the President

Name: Maternity Benefit Act, 1961
ArtDesc: "An Act to regulate the employment of women in certain establishments for certain periods before and after childbirth and to provide for maternity benefit." It ensures paid leave, job protection, and nursing breaks for female employees.

Name: Industrial Employment (Standing Orders) Act, 1946
ArtDesc: "An Act to require employers to define with sufficient precision the conditions of employment." It brings uniformity in service conditions related to classification, termination, discipline, holidays, and misconduct.

Name: Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for certain benefits to employees in case of sickness, maternity and employment injury." It established ESIC to administer health insurance and medical care for workers and their dependents.

Name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947

Name: Code of Criminal Procedure
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to Criminal Procedure." Governs administration of substantive criminal law in India. Came into force April 1, 1974, establishing procedures for arrest, bail, investigation, and trial. Amended multiple times including significant 2013 changes after Nirbhaya case.

Name: Indian Evidence Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate, define and amend the law of Evidence." Determines what evidence is admissible in Indian courts. Came into force September 1, 1872. Establishes rules for witness testimony, documentary evidence, and burden of proof. Amended in 2000 to include electronic evidence.

Name: Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to narcotic drugs." Known as NDPS Act, provides stringent punishment for drug trafficking. Enacted to fulfill India's obligations under UN conventions. Amended in 2001 to allow bail for addicts seeking treatment.

Name: Arms Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to arms and ammunition." Regulates manufacture, sale, possession and carrying of firearms. Requires licenses for most weapons. Amended in 2019 to increase punishment for illegal weapons.

Name: Immoral Traffic Prevention Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to prevent trafficking for commercial sexual exploitation." Originally Suppression of Immoral Traffic Act (SITA), amended in 1986. Criminalizes operating brothels, pimping, and soliciting. Provides for protective homes for victims.

Name: Prevention of Food Adulteration Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to make provision for the prevention of adulteration of food." Replaced by Food Safety Act, 2006 but cases still pending under it. Established standards for food quality and punishment for violations.

Name: Contempt of Courts Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to define and limit the powers of courts in punishing contempt." Defines civil and criminal contempt. Protects judicial authority while balancing free speech. Recent 2021 amendments exclude truth as defense.

Name: Unlawful Activities Prevention Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for effective prevention of unlawful activities." Amended multiple times (2004,2008,2012,2019) to strengthen anti-terror provisions. Allows declaring organizations unlawful and detention without charge.

Name: Information Technology Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide legal recognition for electronic commerce." Defines cyber crimes, digital signatures, and data protection. Section 66A struck down in 2015 (Shreya Singhal case). Amended in 2008 to address cyber terrorism.

Name: Copyright Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend and consolidate the law relating to copyright." Protects literary, artistic, musical works. Amended in 2012 for digital rights management and ISP liability. Term is author's life + 60 years.

Name: Patent Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend and consolidate the law relating to patents." Grants exclusive rights for inventions. Amended in 2005 for TRIPS compliance. Excludes software and business methods. Term: 20 years from filing.

Name: Trademarks Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend and consolidate the law relating to trademarks." Protects brands, logos and distinctive signs. Provides for registration and infringement remedies. Well-known marks get special protection.

Name: Negotiable Instruments Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to define and amend the law relating to Promissory Notes, Bills of Exchange and Cheques." Governs banking instruments. Section 138 covers cheque bounce cases. Amended in 2018 for faster resolution.

Name: Companies Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to companies." Replaced 1956 Act. Introduced CSR, class action suits, and stricter corporate governance. Established NCLT/NCLAT for company disputes.

Name: Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend laws relating to reorganization and insolvency." Unified framework for time-bound resolution. Introduced NCLT process and insolvency professionals. Amended multiple times for efficiency.

Name: Arbitration and Conciliation Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend law relating to domestic and international arbitration." Based on UNCITRAL Model Law. Amended in 2015 and 2019 to promote India as arbitration hub and limit court intervention.

Name: Motor Vehicles Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate laws relating to motor vehicles." Regulates licensing, registration, traffic rules and insurance. Heavily amended in 2019 to increase penalties and introduce cashless treatment.

Name: Railway Claims Tribunal Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to establish Claims Tribunal for expeditious adjudication." Handles compensation claims for railway accidents, untoward incidents and loss of goods. Replaced civil court jurisdiction.

Name: Citizenship Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for acquisition and termination of Indian citizenship." Defines citizenship by birth, descent, registration and naturalization. Amended in 2019 for persecuted minorities from neighboring countries.

Name: Official Secrets Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate the law relating to official secrets." Criminalizes spying, leaking classified information and unauthorized access. Section 5 covers potential breaches. Controversial for press freedom issues.

Name: Epidemic Diseases Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for better prevention of spread of dangerous epidemic diseases." Invoked during COVID-19 pandemic. Grants special powers to states for containment measures. Amended in 2020 to protect healthcare workers.

Name: Disaster Management Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for effective management of disasters." Created NDMA, SDMAs and NDRF. Invoked during COVID-19 for lockdown enforcement. Provides for disaster response funds and mitigation plans.

Name: Right to Information Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for setting out practical regime of right to information." Empowers citizens to access government records. Time-bound response mandated. Established Information Commissions. Excludes security agencies.

Name: Whistle Blowers Protection Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to establish mechanism for receiving complaints on corruption." Protects whistleblowers exposing corruption. Passed after Satyendra Dubey murder case. Amended in 2015 but not fully implemented.

Name: Ancient Monuments Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to protect ancient monuments and archaeological sites." Regulated by Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). Prohibits construction in prohibited areas. Covers national importance sites.

Name: Aircraft Rules
ArtDesc: "Rules regulating manufacture, registration and operation of aircraft." Under Aircraft Act, 1934. Governed by DGCA. Covers licensing, airworthiness, and air transport services.

Name: Boilers Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate laws relating to steam boilers." Provides for inspection and certification. Aims to prevent accidents. Governed by Chief Inspector of Boilers in states.

Name: Census Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for certain matters in connection with census." Mandates decadal population count. Requires citizens to answer questions truthfully. Confidentiality of data guaranteed.

Name: Prisons Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate the law relating to prisons in India." Governs prison administration, prisoner treatment, and discipline. Provides framework for state prison rules.

Name: Prisoners Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate the law relating to prisoners." Deals with prisoner transfers, removal for trial, and temporary release. Complements state prison manuals.

Name: Probation of Offenders Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for release of offenders on probation." Allows first-time offenders to avoid prison through good conduct. Focuses on reformation over punishment.

Name: Juvenile Justice Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate laws relating to children in conflict with law." Establishes Juvenile Justice Boards and Child Welfare Committees. Focuses on rehabilitation.

Name: Prevention of Corruption Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate law relating to prevention of corruption." Criminalizes bribery, embezzlement, and abuse of official position. Applies to public servants.

Name: Goonda Act (State-specific)
ArtDesc: "State laws to control habitual offenders and anti-social elements." Allows preventive detention. Examples include UP Goonda Act, Maharashtra MCOCA.

Name: Identification of Prisoners Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to authorize taking measurements of convicts and suspects." Permits fingerprinting, photographs, and other biometric data collection.

Name: Explosives Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to regulate manufacture, possession and use of explosives." Criminalizes unauthorized handling of explosives. Governed by Chief Controller of Explosives.

Name: Mental Healthcare Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide mental healthcare for persons with mental illness." Decriminalizes suicide attempts. Protects rights of mentally ill prisoners.

Name: Commission of Sati Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for prevention of Sati practice." Criminalizes glorification or abetment of Sati. Provides punishment up to death penalty.

Name: Dowry Prohibition Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to prohibit giving or taking of dowry." Criminalizes dowry demands and provides punishment. Amended to strengthen protections.

Name: Prohibition of Child Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to prohibit solemnization of child marriages." Makes child marriage voidable at minor's option. Provides punishment for adults involved.

Name: Habitual Offenders Act
ArtDesc: "State laws to monitor and restrict movement of habitual criminals." Allows police surveillance and restrictions. Implemented in various states.

Name: Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act
ArtDesc: "State Act to combat organized crime and terrorism." Allows intercepted communications as evidence. Stringent provisions for bail and confessions.

Name: Anti-Hijacking Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to give effect to Beijing Protocol on aircraft hijacking." Provides death penalty for hijacking resulting in death. Replaces 1982 Act.

Name: Juvenile Justice Rules
ArtDesc: "Rules under Juvenile Justice Act for care and protection of children." Details procedures for juvenile boards and rehabilitation.

Name: Model Prison Manual
ArtDesc: "Guidelines for prison administration and inmate management." Focuses on reformative approach, education, and vocational training.

Name: Transfer of Prisoners Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for transfer of prisoners between states/countries." Facilitates prisoner transfers for trial or serving sentences.

Name: Legal Services Authorities Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide free legal aid to certain categories including prisoners." Establishes legal services authorities at various levels.

Name: Criminal Law Amendment Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend laws on rape of minors." Introduced death penalty for rape of girls below 12 years. Fast-track courts for POCSO cases.

Name: Hindu Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend and codify the law relating to marriage among Hindus." Defines Hindu marriage as sacrament with conditions for valid marriage, void/voidable marriages, divorce provisions, and maintenance rights. Applies to Hindus, Buddhists, Jains, and Sikhs.

Name: Special Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide a special form of marriage in certain cases." Enables inter-religion/caste marriages without conversion. Requires 30-day notice period. Governs marriages where either party isn't Hindu, Muslim, Christian, Parsi or Jew.

Name: Indian Christian Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to solemnization of marriages of Christians." Provides procedures for marriage solemnization by ministers, registration requirements, and effects of non-compliance.

Name: Parsi Marriage and Divorce Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend the law relating to marriage and divorce among Parsis." Defines Parsi marriage requirements, prohibits bigamy, and establishes Parsi matrimonial courts. Recognizes 'ashirvad' ceremony.

Name: Muslim Personal Law (Shariat) Application Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to apply Muslim Personal Law to Muslims in personal matters." Governs marriage (nikah), dower (mahr), divorce (talaq), and maintenance. Recognizes oral divorce and polygyny (with conditions).

Name: Prohibition of Child Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to prohibit solemnization of child marriages." Makes child marriage voidable at minor's option. Punishes adults conducting/abetting child marriages. Appointment of Child Marriage Prohibition Officers.

Name: Foreign Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to make provision relating to marriages of citizens of India outside India." Registers marriages where one spouse is Indian citizen performed abroad. Requires notice to marriage officer.

Name: Anand Marriage Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to remove doubts as to validity of marriage rites of Sikhs called Anand." Recognizes Anand Karaj ceremony without requiring civil registration. Amended in 2012 for registration procedures.

Name: Dowry Prohibition Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to prohibit giving or taking of dowry." Criminalizes dowry demands before/during/after marriage. Punishment: 5 years imprisonment + fine. Applies to all religions.

Name: Family Courts Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to provide for establishment of Family Courts." Creates specialized courts for speedy settlement of marriage disputes, divorce, maintenance and child custody cases.

Name: Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to amend and codify law relating to maintenance among Hindus." Secures wife's right to claim maintenance from husband during lifetime. Applies during cohabitation and after separation.

Name: Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Divorce) Act
ArtDesc: "An Act to protect rights of Muslim women divorced by their husbands." Ensures fair provision and maintenance during iddat period. Recognized after Shah Bano case controversy.

Name: Citizenship Act, 1955
ArtDesc: An Act to provide for the acquisition and determination of Indian citizenship, covering acquisition by birth, descent, registration, naturalization, and incorporation of territory.

Name: Official Secrets Act, 1923
ArtDesc: An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to official secrets. It prohibits disclosure of official information that may affect India's sovereignty, integrity, or security.

Name: Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897
ArtDesc: An Act for the better prevention of the spread of dangerous epidemic diseases. It empowers state governments to take special measures to combat outbreaks.

Name: Disaster Management Act, 2005
ArtDesc: An Act to provide for effective management of disasters and to establish authorities such as the NDMA for preparedness, response, and mitigation.

Name: Right to Information Act, 2005
ArtDesc: An Act to empower citizens to access information under the control of public authorities, promoting transparency and accountability in governance.

Name: Whistle Blowers Protection Act, 2014
ArtDesc: An Act to protect individuals who expose corruption or misconduct in public offices and provide a mechanism to investigate such disclosures.

Name: Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act, 1958
ArtDesc: An Act to preserve ancient and historical monuments, archaeological sites and remains of national importance.

Name: Aircraft Rules, 1937
ArtDesc: Rules regulating the operation and maintenance of civil aircraft, formed under the Aircraft Act to ensure aviation safety.

Name: Boilers Act, 1923
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate the use of boilers and ensure the safety of workers and the public in industrial establishments.

Name: Census Act, 1948
ArtDesc: An Act for conducting population censuses in India and ensuring confidentiality of collected data.

Name: Child Marriage Restraint Act, 1929
ArtDesc: An Act to restrain the solemnization of child marriages by setting minimum legal ages and penalties.

Name: Cinematograph Act, 1952
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate the certification and exhibition of cinematograph films for public viewing in India.

Name: Commission of Sati (Prevention) Act, 1987
ArtDesc: An Act to prevent the practice of sati and its glorification. It criminalizes aiding or glorifying sati.

Name: Emblems and Names (Prevention of Improper Use) Act, 1950
ArtDesc: An Act to prevent improper use of certain emblems and names for professional or commercial purposes.

Name: Explosives Act, 1884
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate the manufacture, possession, use, sale, and transport of explosives for public safety.

Name: Indian Telegraph Act, 1885
ArtDesc: An Act to govern telegraph communication and grant the government control over telegraph infrastructure.

Name: Infant Milk Substitutes Act, 1992
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate production, supply, and promotion of infant milk substitutes to protect breastfeeding.

Name: Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act, 1971
ArtDesc: An Act to provide for legal and safe termination of pregnancies under specific conditions by registered practitioners.

Name: Mental Healthcare Act, 2017
ArtDesc: An Act to provide mental health care and protect the rights of individuals with mental illnesses.

Name: Mines Act, 1952
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate the safety, health, and welfare of workers in coal, metalliferous and oil mines.

Name: National Security Act, 1980
ArtDesc: An Act to provide for preventive detention to maintain public order and national security.

Name: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Rules
ArtDesc: Rules under POCSO Act ensuring proper procedures for reporting, recording, and prosecuting child sexual abuse cases.

Name: Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009
ArtDesc: An Act to provide free and compulsory education to all children aged 6 to 14 years.

Name: Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
ArtDesc: An Act to establish SEBI for regulation of securities market and protection of investor interests.

Name: Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act, 1997
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate telecom services and ensure fair competition, consumer protection and transparency.

Name: Transplantation of Human Organs Act, 1994
ArtDesc: An Act to regulate removal, storage, and transplantation of human organs and to prevent commercial dealings.

Name: Wakf Act, 1995
ArtDesc: An Act for administration of Wakf properties dedicated for religious and charitable purposes in Islam.

Name: Water Resources Acts (State-specific)
ArtDesc: Acts passed by various states to govern usage, allocation, and conservation of water resources.

Name: Agricultural Produce Market Committee Acts (State-specific)
ArtDesc: Laws that govern marketing and pricing of agricultural produce through APMC markets in states.

Name: Essential Commodities Act, 1955
ArtDesc: An Act to control the production, supply, and distribution of essential commodities to ensure availability at fair prices.
